page.title: 09The old S&D Railway
page.content: S&D stands for 'Somerset and Dorset.' Most people travelled on the trains. The colour of the trains was black and green. If you started at Stourpaine station the next along the line would be Blandford or Shillingstone. Some people went to work there by train. If you went somewhere you could stay there until the next train you wanted to catch came. People went to places like Temple- combe or Bournemouth, but it was called 'Somerset and Dorset' because it ran through them all the way from Highbridge and Bath to Bournemouth. The railway stopped in 1966. Since then the track has been taken up and people go for walks along it. Many older people still remember crossing the field to catch the train at 'Durweston and Stourpaine Halt.'
